page.title: 05EDUCATION IN PRIVETT
page.content: The 5-11 year old children of the Privett area used to attend the village Church School until 1970, when numbers declined and the school closed. The designated schools are now at Froxfield for infants and at Langrish for juniors, who travel to school by mini-bus.Some parents choose to send their children to Ropley Primary School when there are places available and in this case they are responsible for their transport. At 11-plus the children transfer to Petersfield Comprehensive School which has a sixth form, or to Eggar's School and the Sixth Form College in Alton.
